extendedMetadata.value: Chapter Quiz: How Sociologists Do Research

extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 5.4: Know the main elements of the 7 research methods: surveys, participant observation, case studies, secondary analysis, analysis of documents, experiments, and unobtrusive measures; state why sociological research can lead to controversy.

config.question: Participant observation might cause a dilemma for the researcher in __________.

choices.content: justifying spending money on researching a particular topic
overcoming hesitation of those being observed by establishing rapport
determining whether asking personal questions presents an ethical issue
trying to decide how involved to become with the people who are being observed

answer_3.response: sider this: Asking questions would occur in an interview or survey. Participant observation is a different type of method. LO 5.4 Know the main elements of the 7 research methods: surveys, participant observation, case studies, secondary analysis, analysis of documents, experiments, and unobtrusive measures; state why sociological research can lead to controversy.

answer_2.response: sider this: In participant observation the subjects typically do not know they are being observed.
